alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Crawford; Franklin; Madison; Sebastian; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 8:45PM CST until January 15 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST MONDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. With lighter amounts of snow expected through noon Monday, the Winter Storm Warning has been cancelled and replaced with a Winter Weather Advisory. Additional snow accumulations up to an 1 inch. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Arkansas and southeast Oklahoma. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST Monday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. In Arkansas, for the latest road conditions call 1-800-245- 1672 or go to idrivearkansas.com. In Oklahoma, for the latest road conditions call 1-844-465-4997 or go to okRoads.org.
